SceneDividerUI.Title: Scene Scroller Maker: Scene Divider
SceneDividerUI.Explanation1: This application will guide you through dividing a complete scene to make one or several sub-scenes from it.  The sub-scenes can then be used on their own, or they can be stitched together on a canvas using the Scene Tiler module.
SceneDividerUI.Explanation2: The algorithm uses the Fog of War to define the divisions, one piece at a time.  Your scene must be completely walled and Fog of War turned on.
SceneDividerUI.Explanation3: The background image will be divided and saved in .webp format at a location you must choose.  Do not choose an existing module folder, as those will be overwritten when modules are updated.
SceneDividerUI.ImgSaveLocation1: If you have set a default save location in the module settings, the radio button will be enabled to select that default.
SceneDividerUI.ImgSaveLocation2: Otherwise, use the filepicker to select a folder.
SceneDividerUI.ImgSaveDefault: Use the default image save location from the module settings?
SceneDividerUI.ImgSaveWhere: Select folder to save background images for sub-scenes:
SceneDividerUI.ImgNoDefault: This option becomes available if a default image folder is selected in the module settings.
SceneDividerUI.CompSaveLocation1: If you have set a default compendium in the module settings, the radio button will be enabled to select that default.
SceneDividerUI.CompSaveLocation2: Otherwise, choose from the other options.
SceneDividerUI.CompSaveWhere: Select location to save the sub-scenes:
SceneDividerUI.CompNoDefault: This option becomes enabled if a default scene compendium is selected in the module settings.
SceneDividerUI.CompSaveDefault: Save to the default scene compendium from the module settings?
SceneDividerUI.CompChooseExisting: Select and save to existing compendium?
SceneDividerUI.CompMakeNew: Create and save to a new scene compendium?
SceneDividerUI.EmbedInScene: Embed sub-scene creation data in scene flags and create sub-scenes at a later time?
SceneDividerUI.Explanation4: This application will create a new scene compendium.  You must provide a name for this compendium.
SceneDividerUI.Explanation5: Create new divisions by clicking on the 'PLUS' button at the bottom right.
SceneDividerUI.Explanation6: Enter a sub-scene name below then click on 'Continue' to begin defining the sub-scene area.
SceneDividerUI.ErrorNoSubSceneName: Enter a sub-scene name before continuing.
SceneDividerUI.ErrorDivNotFinish: Finish the in-work Division before creating new ones.
SceneDividerUI.ErrorNoCompName: Enter a name for the new compendium before continuing.
SceneDividerUI.Explanation7: Click and drag cursor to reveal Fog of War.
SceneDividerUI.Explanation8: The explored area reavealed in the Fog of War will define the bounds of the new sub-scene.
SceneDividerUI.Explanation9: NOTE:  You must drag the cursor to spawn the continue button.  A click is not sufficient.
SceneDividerUI.ConfirmUsePack2: for scenes already exists.  Do you wish to add the sub-scenes to this pack?
SceneDividerUI.SceneScrollerNoFlags: Scene Scroller module not active.  Extra data for that module has not been embedded in the compendium scene flags.
SceneDividerUI.SavedToFlags: Division data stored to scene flags for later use.
SceneDividerUI.LoadFlagsContent: Do you wish to display data stored in this scene's flags?

ResizeImageUI.Title: Resize Image Controls and Submit
ResizeImageUI.Instructions1: If the image needs to be resized larger than the scene size, then manually resize the scene.  The final image size MUST be fully contained in the scene.

CropImageUI.Title: Crop Image Instructions and Submit
CropImageUI.Instructions1: Use the drawing tool to cover the area to keep with shapes.  Can use rectangles, circles or polygons.  The only requirement is the drawing shapes overlap at least one other shape.
CropImageUI.Instructions2: However, there is a bug with the Clipper library.  To avoid it, you must draw your shape starting from the top towards the bottom, or from the right towards the left.  If you do not, you will either get holes in the image, or the crop will fail with a warning stating you did not overlap your shapes.
